results.title: Your protection against disease
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Illustrates how germs spread disease, how the body controls micro organisms that enter the body and how good hygiene habits prevent disease.

results.title: Your own place
results.brief_description: Humorously explains the pitfalls of renting and looking after oneself. Two 18 year-old boys rent a flat and fall into strife over bills, shopping, cooking and sharing of tasks; their ever-present landlady/caretaker is always ready to provide sound advice. Raises for consideration the following points: lease v monthly tenancy, rent and bond, secondhand v new furniture, phone installation costs, laundering of clothing, economical places to shop, budgeting, hygiene in the kitchen, basic cooking procedures and rostering of household tasks. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Your obedient servant
results.brief_description: To the layman the world of the computer is surrounded by mystery. This film contends that it should be as acceptable in modern life as are the telephone and television. Man is master and a computer cannot work correctly unless each step is logically planned.

results.title: Your mysterious brain
results.creator_credit: Glyn Jones, British Broadcasting Corporation, Michael Latham and Innes Lloyd
results.brief_description: With the aid of a six-foot model of a human brain and film sequences of brain cells under the microscope the operation of the brain is explained. Brain cells are seen living, dying and linking themselves in the patterns which make human beings behave the way they do. Includes the filming of German artist Horst Pieter drawing under the influence of LSD.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glyn Jones, British Broadcasting Corporation, Michael Latham and Innes Lloyd

results.title: Your mouth
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, Lever Brothers Co. and Charles Smith
results.brief_description: Examines many aspects of the development of the human mouth: growth of teeth; the function of gums, tongue, lips, muscles, nerves and periodontal membrane; and the protective function of saliva. Explains the relation of the mouth to the exercise of taste and smell and the process of human speech.

results.title: Your Money (Captioned)
results.brief_description: We all need money, we all use money. In the ever-changing financial climate, it’s becoming more and more important to have a sound understanding of money management. The difference between those of us who achieve their financial goals and those of us who don’t, can be measured in a few simple rules. “Your money” is an easy to understand step by step guide to making better financial decisions.

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Your money
results.brief_description: This program presented by Margaret Throsby and via interviews with managers of various financial institutions suggest ways for the average man in the street to be informed about good money management. We need to look around at the various means available in order to obtain the best vaulue for money with our personal finances. The following topics are covered :- Budgeting, this ensures we see just where our money goes, Savings accounts, either a simple or compound interest account, Taxation and Inflation, the effects on the economy of the country and how they can erode our savings, Investments or enforced saving such as home ownership or superannuation.
